article.headline: Pepperdine 97, Portland 88
article.story: MALIBU, Calif. (AP) -- Glen McGowan had 24 points and Alex Acker had 21 as Pepperdine beat Portland 97-88 in the West Coast Conference opener for both teams. The Waves had five players in double figures, including Chase Griffin with 13 points, Derick Grubb with 12, and Terrance Johnson with 10. Grubb added 10 rebounds to lead the Waves. Pepperdine (7-7) led by 17 at the half and led by more than 20 for most of the second half, but Portland (5-12) made a late charge, pulling within seven points 91-84 with 22 seconds to play after a 3-pointer from Adam Quick. Portland's Eugene Jeter led all scorers with 33 points. Quick scored 19 and Donald Wilson had 16.
